org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa

Class FSA2Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractAlgorithm
      • org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa.FSA2Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, Algorithm, AlgorithmListener

    public class FSA2Game
extends AbstractAlgorithm
    This class provides a conversion from a deterministic automaton with a propositional alphabet to a turn-based game. Let AP be a finite set of atomic propositions. Let A = (Σ, Q, q0, δ, F) be a deterministic automaton where Σ = 2AP is a finite alphabet, Q a finite set of states, q0 an initial state, δ a transition relation, and F an acceptance condition. Assume all the propositions in APi are controlled by player i for i = 0, 1. Let Σi = 2APi for i = 0, 1. This class constructs a game G = (Σ, V, v0, Δ, W) such that
    • V = V0 ∪ V1 of which Vi is a set of locations controlled by player i for i = 0, 1,
    • V0 = (Q × Σ1),
    • V1 = Q,
    • v0 = q0 is the initial location,
    • Δ((q, a), b) = δ(q, a ∪ b) for a ∈ Σ1 and b ∈ Σ0,
    • Δ(q, a) = (q, a) for a ∈ Σ1, and
    • W is obtained from F by substituting qi for qi and all (qi, sym) with sym ∈ Σ1.
    Note that when making the transition display of the game complete, the labels of the outgoing transitions from a location controlled by player i may contain propositions controlled by its opponent. Such propositions are intended to be ignored.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

    • Constructor Detail

      • FSA2Game

        public FSA2Game(FSA aut,
                java.util.Map<GamePlayer,java.util.Collection<Proposition>> controlled)
        Constructs this algorithm to convert a specified deterministic automaton with a propositional alphabet, labels on transitions, and acceptance condition on states to a turn-based game.
        Parameters:
        aut - a deterministic automaton with a propositional alphabet
        controlled - a map from a player to the propositions controlled by the player
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the automaton is not deterministic, the alphabet of the automaton is not propositional, the labels of the automaton are not on transitions, the acceptance condition of the automaton is not on states, some proposition in the alphabet of the automaton is not controlled by any player, or some proposition controlled by a player is not in the alphabet of the automaton

        public Game convert()
        Converts the input deterministic automaton with a propositional alphabet to a turn-based game.
        Returns:
        a game
